entries.meaning: Something that astonishes; an astonishing thing or event.
examples: Synonyms: astonishment, marvel, surprise, wonder, shocker, stunner (colloquial)
[…]  God, before whom all Nations are as nothing, thou Astonisher of all Flesh, thou art even too Wonderful for me,

entries.meaning: (typography, printing, computing, chiefly US) An exclamation mark, the punctuation mark “!”.
examples: “ […]  Nothing whatever” ! (the italics are “S. S. C.’s,” the “astonisher” is mine.)

entries.meaning: (typography, journalism, chiefly US) A short line of smaller type above (or sometimes below) the main headline of an article, usually placed flush-left.
(journalism) A headline or lead (introductory paragraph) designed to capture attention through a surprising statement.
examples: Synonyms: cartridge lead, punch lead, shocker lead
